number of helpful: 171 of 225 people (76%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 9, 2013
												I saw this on sale for 99 cents and when a game is that cheap, unless the offends your ancestors in some deep and unforgivable way, you buy it. I, like many others on steam, bought this simply because it's this cheap. The 90% off sale is the "we're not making any more money from this" sale last ditch attempt to produce some revenue from a title.  Considering I haven't heard of this rather generic looking, what appears to be some sort of RTS game, I wasn't expecting much and I wasn't surprised in so many ways. Arena Wars 2 is a top down real-time strategy game that pits you against a player or an AI component in what is essentially a match of capture the flag. This is a "first-impression" review as I am honestly unwilling to put more than the hour and 20 minutes I put into this game. The gameplay is very mediocre and the units in the game are fairly uninspired. The game seems to be a "rock paper scissors" game in the sense that one unit is clearly designed to defeat another particular unit. Unfortunately this concept I felt was implented poorly as one unit will do more damage to another unit seemingly abritrarily and it lacks the thougthfulness of a mature RTS game. There is no tutorial or any intro missions to introduce each of the mechanics so the player is thrown in to engage in a trail and error process of figuring everything out. To this game's merit, I do like the idea. This game is designed to get he player in the action right away and matches will end quickly whereas a full RTS game might include 2 hours of base-building prior to any combat. A match or two of this game could be played on a lunch break.This game is an online game but seeing how this game doesn't have a consistent playerbase this is effectively a single player game. There are several difficulty levels and in my first hour and 20 minutes it took getting to the hardest difficulty level to experience any sort of challenge. One very annoying aspect is that these difficulty levels need to be unlocked *per level* and there are five of them. This means that for each level I want to play on, I need to suffer through four matches of boring before I get to the very average gameplay.I noticed a bug where an area-of-effect ability hits the wreck of a tower it will register damage and repeat "Turret destroyed" - there may be more bugs but finding this so readily underlines this game's overall lack of polish.The idea has some merit but I cannot recommend this title for any price. The real cost of a game your own freetime anyway.Score 4/10

number of helpful: 20 of 30 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 13, 2014
												While the singleplayer side of things seems dim and underdeveloped the multiplayer with friends is a huge blast. 1v1 can bring 2 hour wars of attrition or quick sweeps with rush builds that either get crushed with well-thought defense placements or heavy investment for the countering unit(s). Many people are bashing this game for the lack of depth and while the game certainly does lack depth, it can teach a deep appreciation for rts games with it's handful of interesting mechanics to even someone like me who has never touched many rts. If a single dollar can teach me the basics of an rts and build appreciation for more polished games like Starcraft and Red Alert, I'd say that's a dollar damn well spent.

content:
Posted: February 16, 2014
												For every ten or so big releases which disappoint, there’s a relatively small-scale title that comes along and surprises everybody by being pretty good. Arena Wars 2 fits nicely into this category. Fast paced RTS that puts you straight into the action, no mineral collecting to slow the game down. It really is a joy to play a game that hasn't been done what can seem like hundreds of times.

number of helpful: 7 of 12 people (58%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 13, 2014
												I get where they are coming from when it comes to trying to make an arena based strategy game. If you like pulling apart arena games and enjoy trying new ones now and then. (Yikes I know you have invested so much time learning the current ones).On the plus side after playing with the settings I was able to try this game I grabbed in a sale some time ago for 99c.What I liked: * Control over the entire battlefield* Ability to mix and match units when you need to.* Upgrading to your unit strategy. Though the towers lend themselves to only a few winning strats.What I was not so keen on:* Farming power ups and XP on the sides took away some of the promise of "Fast Paced" promise. * Generator concusion blast is too strong. Something that does less damage would be fine, or at least draw out the concussion line around the base so defenses can be set accordingly. * Unit roles are not diverse enough to stop what would inevitably be a battle of attrition. (Whoever upgrades the Destroyers first will take out the turrets and eventually win)* No creeps do make the game seem "Quiet" now and then unless you are taking the action to the other player.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 16, 2014
												Well, I bought it for $.099, and it seemed nice in the screenshots and videos. I also read a couple of positive reviews.When I first launched the game, the intro videos and menu were very sluggish, so I checked the video option and lowered the resolution. Guess what? That didn't help at all, it was still sluggish.I continued to start a game, and here I was lost. There is no indication on how to play this, no objectives, no tutorial or gameplay guide. You have to figure out what every UI element, unit and building does. When I finally figured out how to start, well the game is not fun. After two or three rounds I was bored. And of course, the game was sluggish during gameplay as it was in the game menu, no matter what resolution I chose.The UI is horrible, too big and no way to scale it down. There's no way to zoom out the map, you only see a small portion of it. I found no way to center the screen on a unit or group of units, or to have the camera follow the units.I regret I bought this game, even if it was only $.099.

content:
Posted: December 14, 2014
												Very fun but very few options.If you are bored of the standard RTS games on the market and are looking for something faster paced then you may want to check out Arena Wars 2. There are multiple maps and multiple difficulty levels for AI to keep you busy for a while. There is an online mode which can be tricky to find players on. Also there is not a 2 Human vs 2 AI mode to practice in but there is 2v2 Online Multplayer. If you can get players online then it is a fun and unique experience. If you can't however, then this will be a short lived game for you.

content:
Posted: April 23, 2014
												Arena Wars 2 is a simple real time lane strategy game.  It has reasonable graphics and simple game mechanics.  Build units, clobber enemy units and then steal and capture enemy resources.  If you are looking for a short fast paced strategy game this one should suffice.  It feels more like an arcade game than like a strategy game.  Nothing special, but fun to play.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
												Got it for a dollar and it's well worth the buck.  Unfortunately it's not worth much more than that.  Has great graphics, UI, and physics.  Where it's lacking is in gameplay.  It's extremely basic.  Probably great for a little kid, it's not for adults.  If they marketed it that way it would be better.  I love the capture the flag element to the game.  Hate flag auto returns though even in FPS CTF I hated auto returns.  Game could be so much better and sell more if they put more work into making it more strategic, allowing more units on the field (units cost much less).  Then you'd have a really good game because the CTF aspect is really great.  The different power ups are nice but they rarely help a lot.  Would be nice to see more power ups and ways to get them.  For the cost... can't complain just a little disappointing that this game has so much potential that isn't being developed.

number of helpful: 6 of 24 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
												Arena Wars 2 is the sequel of the award-winning Arena Wars series and combines revolutionary RTS fights with RPG elements. Join the Battlefield of the future and prove your skills in fast paced multiplayer matches as well as against the advanced AI. Stunning maps, highly detailed units, powerful upgrades and skills as well as a best balanced gameplay offer intensive fights in a spectacular Sci-Fi scenario. Thanks to an easy accessibility and different AI levels, Arena Wars 2 is the perfect RTS game for all kind of gamers.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 10, 2013
												AI pathfinding is bad.  it may not be fair to compare this game with other RTS games like Starcraft 2.  But controlling your units is so much more natural in SC2, that it makes this game feel obsolete - which is weird because SC2 came out in 2010 and Arena Wars 2 is newer.  Too bad they did not implement some of the gameplay and control ideas.the game did not hold interest very long.  but for $1, might as well check it out.  not a big loss if you dont like it.

content:
Posted: March 16, 2014
												This is a pretty easy game to beat. Rush artillary and a couple heavy support units to one or both fortified positions. Use remaining points to produce scout units to harvest experience points and deny said points to opponent. Hit level ten and then go in for the kill.Rinse and repeat......for every map in the campaign. At every level, ad nauseum. Not worth the 99 cents that I paid for it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 18, 2014
												Well, I bought it for $0.79, and it seemed nice in the screenshots and videos. I also read a couple of positive reviews.When I first launched the game, the intro videos and menu were very sluggish, so I checked the video option and lowered the resolution. Guess what? That didn't help at all, it was still sluggish.I continued to start a game, and here I was lost. There is no indication on how to play this, no objectives, no tutorial or gameplay guide. You have to figure out what every UI element, unit and building does. When I finally figured out how to start, well the game is not fun. After two or three rounds I was bored. And of course, the game was sluggish during gameplay as it was in the game menu, no matter what resolution I chose.The UI is horrible, too big and no way to scale it down. There's no way to zoom out the map, you only see a small portion of it. I found no way to center the screen on a unit or group of units, or to have the camera follow the units.I regret I bought this game, even if it was only $0.79
